{"id":683263567,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 year, 8 months","timestamp":1650345564,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/683263567/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"N/A","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\n    TreeNode* first=NULL;\n    TreeNode* second=NULL;\n    TreeNode* prev=new TreeNode(INT_MIN);\npublic:\n    \n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        help(root);\n        swap(first->val,second->val);\n    }\n    \n    void help(TreeNode* root)\n    {\n        if(root==NULL)\n            return;\n        help(root->left);\n        if(first==NULL && prev->val >=root->val)\n            first=prev;\n        if(first!=NULL && prev->val >=root->val)\n            second=root;\n        prev=root;\n        help(root->right);\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
